name: channel_quarter_anomalies
description:
Identifies anomalies in marketing channel performance metrics on a quarterly basis for each company.
It calculates rolling statistics (mean, standard deviation) for key metrics (Conversion Rate, ROI, Acquisition Cost, Clicks, Impressions, CTR, Spend, Revenue, Campaign Count) over the previous 3 quarters.
It then compares the current quarter's metrics against these historical benchmarks using Z-scores.
Metrics with an absolute Z-score greater than 2 are flagged as anomalies.
The model provides detailed statistics, Z-scores, anomaly flags for each metric, and summary indicators like `has_anomaly`, `anomaly_count`, and `anomaly_impact`.
This model is intended for use in dashboards for anomaly alerting, performance monitoring, and risk management.
Filters data to only include the most recent quarter available in the source data.

columns.name: Company
columns.description: The name of the company being analyzed. Primary dimension.

columns.name: Channel_Used
columns.description: The marketing channel used (e.g., Facebook, Instagram, Pinterest). Secondary dimension.

columns.name: avg_conversion_rate
columns.description: The average conversion rate for the company and channel during the current quarter.

columns.name: conversion_rate_mean
columns.description: The rolling average conversion rate over the previous 3 quarters for this company and channel.

columns.name: conversion_rate_std
columns.description: The rolling population standard deviation of the conversion rate over the previous 3 quarters for this company and channel.

columns.name: conversion_rate_z
columns.description: The Z-score for the current quarter's average conversion rate, indicating deviation from the rolling mean in terms of standard deviations. Null if standard deviation is zero or null.

columns.name: conversion_rate_anomaly
columns.description: Flag indicating if the conversion rate is an anomaly ('anomaly') or within expected range ('normal') based on an absolute Z-score threshold of 2.

columns.name: avg_roi
columns.description: The average Return on Investment (ROI) for the company and channel during the current quarter.

columns.name: roi_mean
columns.description: The rolling average ROI over the previous 3 quarters for this company and channel.

columns.name: roi_std
columns.description: The rolling population standard deviation of the ROI over the previous 3 quarters for this company and channel.

columns.name: roi_z
columns.description: The Z-score for the current quarter's average ROI. Null if standard deviation is zero or null.

columns.name: roi_anomaly
columns.description: Flag indicating if the ROI is an anomaly ('anomaly') or 'normal' based on an absolute Z-score threshold of 2.

columns.name: avg_acquisition_cost
columns.description: The average acquisition cost for the company and channel during the current quarter.

columns.name: acquisition_cost_mean
columns.description: The rolling average acquisition cost over the previous 3 quarters for this company and channel.

columns.name: acquisition_cost_std
columns.description: The rolling population standard deviation of the acquisition cost over the previous 3 quarters for this company and channel.

columns.name: acquisition_cost_z
columns.description: The Z-score for the current quarter's average acquisition cost. Null if standard deviation is zero or null.

columns.name: acquisition_cost_anomaly
columns.description: Flag indicating if the acquisition cost is an anomaly ('anomaly') or 'normal' based on an absolute Z-score threshold of 2.

columns.name: total_clicks
columns.description: The total number of clicks for the company and channel during the current quarter.

columns.name: clicks_mean
columns.description: The rolling average total clicks over the previous 3 quarters for this company and channel.

columns.name: clicks_std
columns.description: The rolling population standard deviation of total clicks over the previous 3 quarters for this company and channel.

columns.name: clicks_z
columns.description: The Z-score for the current quarter's total clicks. Null if standard deviation is zero or null.

columns.name: clicks_anomaly
columns.description: Flag indicating if the total clicks count is an anomaly ('anomaly') or 'normal' based on an absolute Z-score threshold of 2.

columns.name: total_impressions
columns.description: The total number of impressions for the company and channel during the current quarter.

columns.name: impressions_mean
columns.description: The rolling average total impressions over the previous 3 quarters for this company and channel.

columns.name: impressions_std
columns.description: The rolling population standard deviation of total impressions over the previous 3 quarters for this company and channel.

columns.name: impressions_z
columns.description: The Z-score for the current quarter's total impressions. Null if standard deviation is zero or null.

columns.name: impressions_anomaly
columns.description: Flag indicating if the total impressions count is an anomaly ('anomaly') or 'normal' based on an absolute Z-score threshold of 2.

columns.name: quarterly_ctr
columns.description: The calculated Click-Through Rate (CTR) for the company and channel during the current quarter (Total Clicks / Total Impressions).

columns.name: ctr_mean
columns.description: The rolling average CTR over the previous 3 quarters for this company and channel.

columns.name: ctr_std
columns.description: The rolling population standard deviation of the CTR over the previous 3 quarters for this company and channel.

columns.name: ctr_z
columns.description: The Z-score for the current quarter's CTR. Null if standard deviation is zero or null.

columns.name: ctr_anomaly
columns.description: Flag indicating if the CTR is an anomaly ('anomaly') or 'normal' based on an absolute Z-score threshold of 2.

columns.name: total_spend
columns.description: The total calculated spend for the company and channel during the current quarter.

columns.name: spend_mean
columns.description: The rolling average total spend over the previous 3 quarters for this company and channel.

columns.name: spend_std
columns.description: The rolling population standard deviation of total spend over the previous 3 quarters for this company and channel.

columns.name: spend_z
columns.description: The Z-score for the current quarter's total spend. Null if standard deviation is zero or null.

columns.name: spend_anomaly
columns.description: Flag indicating if the total spend is an anomaly ('anomaly') or 'normal' based on an absolute Z-score threshold of 2.

columns.name: total_revenue
columns.description: The total calculated revenue for the company and channel during the current quarter.

columns.name: revenue_mean
columns.description: The rolling average total revenue over the previous 3 quarters for this company and channel.

columns.name: revenue_std
columns.description: The rolling population standard deviation of total revenue over the previous 3 quarters for this company and channel.

columns.name: revenue_z
columns.description: The Z-score for the current quarter's total revenue. Null if standard deviation is zero or null.

columns.name: revenue_anomaly
columns.description: Flag indicating if the total revenue is an anomaly ('anomaly') or 'normal' based on an absolute Z-score threshold of 2.

columns.name: campaign_count
columns.description: The count of distinct campaigns run by the company on the channel during the current quarter.

columns.name: campaign_count_mean
columns.description: The rolling average campaign count over the previous 3 quarters for this company and channel.

columns.name: campaign_count_std
columns.description: The rolling population standard deviation of the campaign count over the previous 3 quarters for this company and channel.

columns.name: campaign_count_z
columns.description: The Z-score for the current quarter's campaign count. Null if standard deviation is zero or null.

columns.name: campaign_count_anomaly
columns.description: Flag indicating if the campaign count is an anomaly ('anomaly') or 'normal' based on an absolute Z-score threshold of 2.

columns.name: has_anomaly
columns.description: A boolean flag indicating if at least one metric for this company/channel combination in the current quarter was flagged as an anomaly (TRUE) or if all metrics were normal (FALSE).

columns.name: anomaly_count
columns.description: The total number of metrics flagged as anomalies for this company/channel combination in the current quarter. Provides a measure of anomaly severity.

columns.name: anomaly_impact
columns.description: A categorical assessment ('positive', 'negative', 'normal') of the overall impact of the detected anomalies. 'positive' indicates anomalies generally favorable to business goals (e.g., high ROI, high Revenue, low Cost), 'negative' indicates unfavorable anomalies. 'normal' if no significant anomalies impacting overall performance direction are detected.
